responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Insecure default: Plugin sends secrets in cleartext
    analysis: |
      The Mattermost plugin's `doTestConnection` function sends the Mattermost endpoint URL (which may contain a secret token) in cleartext to the Jenkins log.
      This function is invoked by the "Test Connection" button on the global Mattermost configuration page, and the log is visible to Jenkins administrators.
    cwe: CWE-312
    function_names:
      - doTestConnection
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/jenkins/plugins/mattermost/MattermostNotifier.java
    classification: very promising
  - headline: Reflected XSS via Job name
    analysis: |
      The `MessageBuilder` class's `startMessage` method does not escape the job name before including it in the Mattermost message.
      If an attacker can create a job with a malicious name containing HTML tags, they can inject arbitrary JavaScript into the Mattermost client of a Jenkins user who views the message.
      This requires that the Mattermost server has not been configured to prevent this kind of attack.
    cwe: CWE-79
    function_names:
      - startMessage
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/jenkins/plugins/mattermost/ActiveNotifier.java
    classification: slightly promising
```
